byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz, Isabel Kershner and Said Ghazali contributed reporting.

abstract: Palestinian residents of East Jerusalem describe atmosphere of despair that is driving force behind spate of knife attacks against Israelis; residents say they feel separated from Palestinian institutions in West Bank and like second-class citizens in city where their people have history.
lead_paragraph: East Jerusalem, long the emotional heart of Palestinian life, is now the fiery soul of its discontent: Its residents feel neglected by the Israeli government and the Palestinian Authority.

headline.main: East Jerusalem, Bubbling Over With Despair
headline.print_headline: East Jerusalem, Bubbling Over With Despair

snippet: East Jerusalem, long the emotional heart of Palestinian life, is now the fiery soul of its discontent: Its residents feel neglected by the Israeli government and the Palestinian Authority.
